org.jscripter.emu.java
Class JavaClass

java.lang.Object
  org.jscripter.emu.java.JavaObject
      org.jscripter.emu.java.JavaInterface
          org.jscripter.emu.java.JavaClass

public class JavaClass
extends JavaInterface

An internal class for the emulation of Java class objects.

This class is only used internally by JS re-compiler implementations.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
This class is only loaded and resolved by re-compiler implementations.

getClass

public static final JavaClass getClass(java.lang.Object o)

Internally gets the Java class of an object.

Parameters:
o - An object or value.
Returns:
A Java class object representing the Java class of the object or null if the value is not a Java object.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.

isSuperClass

public static final boolean isSuperClass(JavaClass sup,
                                         JavaClass sub)

Internally determines whether a Java class object represents a super class of that another Java class object does.

Parameters:
sup - A Java class object.
sub - A Java class object.
Returns:
true if the 1st Java class object represents a super class of that the 2nd Java class object does; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.

createClass

protected static final JavaClass createClass(js.ArrayLike<java.lang.String> name,
                                             JavaClass superClass)

Internally creates a Java class object with its name and super class.

Parameters:
name - Represents the name of a Java class.
superClass - Represents the name of a Java class.
Returns:
The newly created Java class object.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.

setInterfaces

protected static final void setInterfaces(JavaClass jc,
                                          js.ArrayLike<JavaInterface> si)

Internally stores the implemented interfaces to a Java class object.

Parameters:
jc - Represents a Java class.
si - Represents all the interfaces for a Java class.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.
